Dialogue: But why is it doing what it's doing?  Given it's resources, it could have done anything. Presented me with your double, and you with mine.

Speaker: snow
Dialogue: Perhaps it did.

Speaker: kelvin
Dialogue: Human beings can die.

Speaker: snow
Dialogue: But they are human.  They certainly become human with incredible speed. First they're like they were in our memory, but then they fill in on their own.  DNA doesn't determine the hundreds of trillions of connections that occur in the brain, it's not dense enough.  They build up with experience.

Speaker: kelvin
Dialogue: They come when you sleep.

Speaker: snow
Dialogue: That's right.  And we all have to sleep, eventually.

Speaker: rheya
Dialogue: You don't want me.

Speaker: kelvin
Dialogue: Rheya.

Speaker: rheya
Dialogue: That's what you were saying.  I heard what you were saying.

Speaker: kelvin
Dialogue: For a reason that neither of us understand, you are forced to stay near me.  That's all I know right now.

Speaker: rheya
Dialogue: I have these strange thoughts, I don't know where they come from.  I can't explain it.

Speaker: kelvin
Dialogue: Neither can I.  Not any of it. There's no reference point for what's going on; it's never happened before.  It's a clean break in the fabric of the Universe; a gap.  There is nothing to do but experience it, moment-to- moment, and not let it destroy us.

Speaker: rheya
Dialogue: But that's what happened before.

Speaker: kelvin
Dialogue: Not this time.

Speaker: rheya
Dialogue: Do you want to stay here?

Speaker: kelvin
Dialogue: Do you?

Speaker: rheya
Dialogue: If you're here.

Speaker: kelvin
Dialogue: Gibarian.

Speaker: gibarian
Dialogue: Leave the light off.

Speaker: gibarian
Dialogue: I wish you'd come a little sooner. I might not have had to kill myself.

Speaker: gibarian
Dialogue: You think you're dreaming me, like you dream her.  Understand something: I am the real Gibarian. Just a new incarnation.

Speaker: kelvin
Dialogue: What do you want?

Speaker: gibarian
Dialogue: You're being tricked.  Sartorius picked a fight with you to avoid telling you about his idea for getting rid of the visitors.  He's figured out they're made of subatomic particles called neutrinos, and he's going to create a negative neutrino field.  Twenty four hours a day, until they're back on Earth.

Speaker: kelvin
Dialogue: Can it work?

Speaker: gibarian
Dialogue: It can.  Ordinary matter, like ours?  Not affected.  Everything else, disintegrates.

Speaker: gibarian
Dialogue: What I'm saying is: Don't trust anyone.  Find yourself a weapon of some sort.

Speaker: kelvin
Dialogue: I can trust Rheya.

Speaker: gibarian
Dialogue: You'll end up like me.

Speaker: kelvin
Dialogue: You're not Gibarian...

Speaker: gibarian
Dialogue: No?  Who am I, then?

Speaker: kelvin
Dialogue: A puppet.

Speaker: gibarian
Dialogue: And you're not?  Maybe you're my puppet.  But like all puppets, you think you're actually human.  It's The Puppet's Dream.  Wondering if they're human!

Speaker: rheya
Dialogue: What's wrong?

Speaker: kelvin
Dialogue: Gibarian.  He was here.

Speaker: rheya
Dialogue: You said he was dead.

Speaker: kelvin
Dialogue: He is.  But he was here...

Speaker: kelvin
Dialogue: He spoke to me.

Speaker: kelvin
Dialogue: Are you going to take them?

Speaker: rheya
Dialogue: What's happening to us?

Speaker: kelvin
Dialogue: It's all right.

Speaker: rheya
Dialogue: Please don't lie.  I told you before, I don't know how I came to be here.  Whatever you think you can't say to me, I need to hear you say it.

Speaker: kelvin
Dialogue: I love you.

Speaker: rheya
Dialogue: Don't.  I'm the one at risk here. If we're playing out what happened before, I won't survive.

Speaker: kelvin
Dialogue: That won't happen again.  We're different.

Speaker: rheya
Dialogue: How can I tell?  You've seen both of me.  I only know what you're like here.  You're all I know. There is no "You" from before.

Speaker: rheya
Dialogue: How could it be so cruel?  How could it torture us like this?

Speaker: kelvin
Dialogue: I don't think it knows it's torturing us.  It's just watching.

Speaker: snow
Dialogue: What happened?

Speaker: kelvin
Dialogue: She drank liquid oxygen.

Speaker: kelvin
Dialogue: She's dead.

Speaker: snow
Dialogue: She'll come back, don't worry.  But then what?  My theory is she can only live here, that she will die if she leaves this ship.

Speaker: snow
Dialogue: Why do you think she hasn't suggested that?  It's the most obvious solution: Escape.  She knows she can't leave here --

Speaker: kelvin
Dialogue: Get out --

Speaker: snow
Dialogue: Oh, this one you love?  What about the first one, the one you fucked and then put into a rocket and blasted into space?  You didn't love her?

Speaker: snow
Dialogue: What happens if she comes back?  Is that polygamy?  And even if you could take her home, how would you get her through?  You think they're not going to notice her?

Speaker: snow
Dialogue: I never get used to them, these... "Resurrections".

Speaker: rheya
Dialogue: What am I?  Why can't I die?

Speaker: rheya
Dialogue: I'm not Rheya.  You're always known that.

Speaker: kelvin
Dialogue: Rheya --

Speaker: rheya
Dialogue: Don't call me that.

Speaker: kelvin
Dialogue: Listen: I don't care about anything but the fact that you are here. You are her, you are Rheya.

Speaker: rheya
Dialogue: I'm disgusting.

Speaker: kelvin
Dialogue: No.

Speaker: rheya
Dialogue: You're lying.  I'm not human.

Speaker: kelvin
Dialogue: Rheya, I am not going back.  I'm staying here with you.

Speaker: rheya
Dialogue: Then you'll die.

Speaker: kelvin
Dialogue: I want every second I can get with you.

Speaker: rheya
Dialogue: What will I do, if you die?

Speaker: rheya
Dialogue: Do you think I can get pregnant here?

Speaker: kelvin
Dialogue: We'll know soon enough.

Speaker: rheya
Dialogue: I can't be a mother.

Speaker: kelvin
Dialogue: That's good to know.

Speaker: rheya
Dialogue: Don't do this.  I am literally begging you not to do this.  Chris.

Speaker: kelvin
Dialogue: You should have told me.

Speaker: rheya
Dialogue: It wouldn't have made any difference.

Speaker: kelvin
Dialogue: Thank you.

Speaker: rheya
Dialogue: Chris, I had to.  I had to.  I didn't think you'd react like this.

Speaker: kelvin
Dialogue: Neither did I.

Speaker: rheya
Dialogue: You never said you wanted one.

Speaker: kelvin
Dialogue: I never said I didn't.

Speaker: rheya
Dialogue: Chris --

Speaker: kelvin
Dialogue: I can't stay here.

Speaker: rheya
Dialogue: Chris, please.  Chris, I'm serious. I won't make it.

Speaker: kelvin
Dialogue: Then you won't make it.

Speaker: kelvin
Dialogue: I came back.  You have to know that.  I came back that night.

Speaker: kelvin
Dialogue: I couldn't make it, either.  I'm so sorry.

Speaker: gibarian
Dialogue: If they succeed, you'll never see her again.

Speaker: rheya
Dialogue: You're afraid of me.  I can't do this anymore.  I still don't understand.  It's not possible.

Speaker: rheya
Dialogue: Don't --

Speaker: rheya
Dialogue: What do I have to do to stop it?

Speaker: kelvin
Dialogue: I want you here.

Speaker: rheya
Dialogue: You're lying.

Speaker: kelvin
Dialogue: You exist here.  I keep telling you.

Speaker: rheya
Dialogue: That's impossible.  I'm not Rheya.

Speaker: kelvin
Dialogue: Who are you, then?

Speaker: rheya
Dialogue: I... I am Rheya.  But I am not the woman you loved ten years ago.

Speaker: kelvin
Dialogue: Yes, you are --

Speaker: rheya
Dialogue: Did you hear what Gibarian said? I'm not a human being.  I'm an instrument.  I came from your memory and your imagination and I will torture you no matter what. Even if I remain passive.  That's when I drank the...  I was going mad.  It felt like there was no body underneath my skin.  There was something else. An illusion.  But I could feel my heart beating, and I remembered you tested my blood.  Is it like yours?

Speaker: kelvin
Dialogue: Yes.  I told you.  It was exactly like mine.

Speaker: rheya
Dialogue: But then I would be dead now.

Speaker: kelvin
Dialogue: Is that really what you want?

Speaker: rheya
Dialogue: I want to stop taking those pills.

Speaker: kelvin
Dialogue: I wish you wouldn't.

Speaker: rheya
Dialogue: They do something to me.  It's hard to think straight.

Speaker: kelvin
Dialogue: I think they help.

Speaker: rheya
Dialogue: I have consciousness, but I am not mortal.  Don't you see why I'm going crazy?

Speaker: kelvin
Dialogue: You have to remember that I love you, that's all that matters --

Speaker: rheya
Dialogue: I can't --

Speaker: kelvin
Dialogue: It put you here.  I'll admit it, it acted like a God and put you here, put you into my consciousness. I was asleep, and it put you into my dream.  I saw your mouth.  And there you were.  Whether you've been sent here to make me happy or punish me, it doesn't matter.  The decision we make now is all that matters.  Stay with me.

Speaker: rheya
Dialogue: Am I really her?

Speaker: kelvin
Dialogue: I don't know anymore.  All I see is you.

Speaker: kelvin
Dialogue: Stay with me.  Stay with me.

Speaker: kelvin
Dialogue: She knows everything.  She knows who she is.

Speaker: snow
Dialogue: She knows everything?  Does she know she came once before and you put her in --

Speaker: kelvin
Dialogue: No.

Speaker: snow
Dialogue: What do you want?

Speaker: kelvin
Dialogue: I want you to get Sartorius to abandon his plan.

Speaker: snow
Dialogue: What plan?

Speaker: kelvin
Dialogue: Just get him to stop.

Speaker: snow
Dialogue: What do you want to do, leave the station with her?

Speaker: kelvin
Dialogue: Yes.

Speaker: snow
Dialogue: Kelvin, she'll disintegrate.  You don't believe me?  Let's radio that shuttle pod you launched -- better yet, let's go get it.  I've charted it's trajectory, only take a few hours...

Speaker: kelvin
Dialogue: Her oxygen would have run out.

Speaker: snow
Dialogue: Maybe she doesn't need any.  Should we check?

Speaker: snow
Dialogue: Who are you trying to please? Yourself?  Her?  Which her, this one or that one.  Can you face both?  We are in a situation that is beyond morality.  So: Leave with her.  You'll see the transformation.

Speaker: kelvin
Dialogue: Into what?

Speaker: snow
Dialogue: You'll see her die, that's all. They're mortal, despite what she told you.  She will die.  Then what will you do?

Speaker: kelvin
Dialogue: I love her.

Speaker: snow
Dialogue: You do, you don't.  She's willing to give her life, you're willing to give yours, it's touching and magnificent, anything you want but -- this isn't the place for it. Don't you see?  No, you don't.

Speaker: sartorius
Dialogue: I'm sending you a message because I feel sorry for you.  I really do, Kelvin.  They sold us out to the highest bidder.  They had no right to do that.  We should have been consulted.  We're not fucking hardware.

Speaker: rheya
Dialogue: What are you taking?

Speaker: kelvin
Dialogue: A sleeping pill.  Do you want yours?

Speaker: kelvin
Dialogue: What does it want?

Speaker: rheya
Dialogue: I don't know.  Something. Anything.

Speaker: rheya
Dialogue: It created me and yet I can't communicate with it.  It must hear me, though.  It must know what's happening to me.  Don't you think?

Speaker: snow
Dialogue: I don't think it dislikes us.  I think it just noticed us.  It lives, thinks, and acts.  We are dealing with a living creature here, no question.  And it's done something we've never been able to do: create a perfect human body. Perfect except for the subatomic alterations, but...

Speaker: gibarian
Dialogue: If Solaris is inside our brain, and it knows everything, and we're only consciously aware of what 2% of our brain is up to at any given moment, it knows us better than we know ourselves.  It's not even close.

Speaker: rheya
Dialogue: I've decided that if it is God, it's a sick God.  Its ambitions exceed its powers, but it doesn't realize it.  And us?  We would have to have "an arrangement".  An unspoken understanding that I am not human. How can I not hate something that does that?

Speaker: kelvin
Dialogue: Please.  Don't.

Speaker: kelvin
Dialogue: Where did you go before?

Speaker: rheya
Dialogue: When?

Speaker: kelvin
Dialogue: Last night.  You were talking to someone in the corridor.

Speaker: rheya
Dialogue: You must have been dreaming.

Speaker: kelvin
Dialogue: What's the matter?

Speaker: kelvin
Dialogue: Rheya?

Speaker: rheya
Dialogue: Don't blame them.  I begged them to do it.  It's better this way.  I read my own suicide note.  I found it in your things.  I realized I was not her.

Speaker: rheya
Dialogue: I know that you loved me, Chris.  I know that.  I love you.

Speaker: kelvin
Dialogue: "Though they go mad they shall be sane.  Though they sink through the sea they shall rise again."

Speaker: kelvin
Dialogue: You murdered her!

Speaker: sartorius
Dialogue: Kelvin, she begged me.  I had a short-range version of the destabilizer prototype, a miniature with a range of a few meters.  She walked into it and disappeared. She was gone.

Speaker: kelvin
Dialogue: She'll come back.

Speaker: sartorius
Dialogue: No, she won't.

Speaker: kelvin
Dialogue: Why would you let her to do that?

Speaker: sartorius
Dialogue: It's not human, Kelvin.  Whatever it is, it's not human, and I am threatened by that.  Evolution-of- the-species-at-stake threatened. And I want to win.  I want humans to win.  So I am killing it before it kills me.

Speaker: kelvin
Dialogue: You fucking bastard...

Speaker: sartorius
Dialogue: Whose side are you on?

Speaker: sartorius
Dialogue: It's changing characteristics. It's solidifying taking on weight.

Speaker: kelvin
Dialogue: How quickly?

Speaker: sartorius
Dialogue: If it continues, it will implode from its own weight and turn into a black hole in about four hours and pulls us in with it.

Speaker: kelvin
Dialogue: Where's Snow?  Did you call him?

Speaker: sartorius
Dialogue: Yes.

Speaker: kelvin
Dialogue: Snow!  We need you up here.

Speaker: kelvin
Dialogue: Snow!

Speaker: kelvin
Dialogue: What's wrong with you?  We need your help.

Speaker: snow
Dialogue: I won't be making the trip.

Speaker: sartorius
Dialogue: Snow, get up here, now.

Speaker: snow
Dialogue: I'm not Snow.

Speaker: snow
Dialogue: I got rid of him.  I wanted to see if... I wanted to be the only one. I wanted to be Snow.

Speaker: sartorius
Dialogue: Fuck me.  I knew it.

Speaker: kelvin
Dialogue: When did this happen?

Speaker: snow
Dialogue: Oh, right away.  That's why you never saw me with anyone.  You should've noticed that.  I miss him, though.  I think I made a mistake.

Speaker: kelvin
Dialogue: Jesus...

Speaker: snow
Dialogue: But I can't leave with you.  I won't make it.

Speaker: kelvin
Dialogue: Maybe you can.

Speaker: sartorius
Dialogue: You want it coming back with us?

Speaker: snow
Dialogue: You go ahead.  Of what I remember about Earth... it's all one thing now.  Everything's a blur.  I like distinctions.

Speaker: sartorius
Dialogue: We do not have time to deal with this.  Get the diode sail into position and let me know when the bias drive and the induction ring are at zero point.

Speaker: kelvin
Dialogue: How can you be here...

Speaker: rheya
Dialogue: Stay with me.  Everything is forgiven.  Everything.

Speaker: kelvin
Dialogue: I love you.
